str2: From hupokrinomai; an actor under an assumed character, i.e. a dissembler
First, in the first place, before, formerly. Neuter of protos as adverb; firstly.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To throw (cast, put) out; I banish; I bring forth, produce. From ek and ballo; to eject.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A beam or spar of timber. From dechomai; a stick of timber.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
The eye; fig: the mind's eye. From optanomai; the eye; by implication, vision; figuratively, envy.
Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To see through, see clearly. From dia and blepo; to look through, i.e. Recover full vision.

The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A dry stalk, chip of wood, twig, splinter, chaff. From karpho; a dry twig or straw.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
